alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 1:51PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yavapai County near Dewey-Humboldt through 230 PM MST... At 150 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dewey-Humboldt, or 10 miles east of Prescott Valley, moving east at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, up to half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Prescott Valley, Dewey-Humboldt, Cherry, Powell Springs Campground and Mingus Mountain Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 277 and 278. State Route 69 between mile markers 281 and 285. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
